text: Hi <@U065R73V8SY>, thanks for the follow - our infrastructure has moved on since then and we have Twilio writing to a specific field that is triggering the enrollment.

Is there a channel to showcase workflow scripts used in custom code actions by proactive users so we can share them with the community. There is <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> but this is being used by companies promoting their own IP. Maybe something like `#workflow-showcase`  or along those lines?
They have a workflows library in the community pages: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Resources/ct-p/resources?node_id=workflows_library&order_by=last_updated>

This is what I was trying to avoid, see attached. With so many active users, the quickest way would be to scroll/ search through a dedicated channel or something similar. Surely there is a better way than this?

Hi there.

Did anyone encounter a similar issue?
Workflow is using Custom Code action / NodeJs 20.x.
As a first import it has
```const AWS = require('aws-sdk');```
Workflow is reporting a following problem:
`ERROR Uncaught Exception {"errorType":"Runtime.ImportModuleError","errorMessage":"Error: Cannot find module 'aws-sdk'\nRequire stack:\n- /var/task/file.js\n- /var/task/HubSpotHandler.js\n- /var/runtime/index.mjs","stack":["Runtime.ImportModuleError: Error: Cannot find module 'aws-sdk'","`

HubSpot documentation states that aws-sdk is supported in NodeJs, so I would expect this to work.

Apparently Node.js 20.x didn’t have AWS included.

if you switch it back to Node.js 16.x it will work.
Thanks a million <@U03REFNRMB3>. I would never have guessed that. It works now!
:boom: !

Hi everyone. Is anyone else having auth issues when creating a custom workflow action definition? I’ve setup the proper scopes and the API key works for other API calls.

```HTTP 401

{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "The API key provided is invalid. View or manage your API key here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/api-key/>"```
<@U022ANB8ZC4> are you the best to see if we could get this fixed for `Node 20.x` and the AWS package?
For context: I’m using my private app’s PAT and appId

it doesn’t look like you provided the Headers correctly.

Did you add in `Authorization: Bearer {{Private App Token}}`?

Alex, do you have a GitHub REPO?

I’ve got a whole collection of custom coded actions and links to other repos from the community: <https://github.com/imageinabox/HubSpot-custom-code-action>
That is an excellent idea :bulb:  I think I’ll do that
I am not but can pass along to the right team! Does anyone mind sharing sample code that was causing this error to pop up so we can take a look on our side?

From that email, you need to use your developer API Key, Not a Private App Token.

Navigate to: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/api-key/> and make sure to select your Developer Portal.
so not the sandbox account where my app lives?
ahh i see! thank you
